Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: Elements
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: A type that represents the collection of the elements that the algorithm is sorting.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: input
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: The given elements that the algorithm is sorting.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: currentIndex
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: The position of the first element in the left paritition to be merged.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: output
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: The current result of applying the sorting algorithm to input.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: partitionSize
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: The number of elements in each partition being merged.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: outputAfterTransactions
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: The value of output after applying the uncommitted transactions from the ongoing merge.

Structs/MergeSort/Merge.html.name: Merge
Structs/MergeSort/Merge.html.abstract: An algorithm that takes two sorted sub-lists and produces a single sorted list.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: calculateMaximumNumberOfComparisonsInWorstCase(for:)
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: Returns the number of comparisons that the algorithm will perform, in the worst case, given an input

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: answer(_:)
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: Answers the current comparison with the given answer.

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: callAsFunction()
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: Executes the algorithm in its current state and, if possible, advances it to the next state and returns the

Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.name: peekAtElement(for:)
Structs/MergeSort.html#/s:19SortStateUni.abstract: Returns the element that represents the given side of the current comparison.

Structs/Comparison.html#/s:19SortStateUn.name: subscript(_:)
Structs/Comparison.html#/s:19SortStateUn.abstract: Accesses the element for the specified side.

Structs/Comparison.html#/s:19SortStateUn.name: callAsFunction(_:)
Structs/Comparison.html#/s:19SortStateUn.abstract: Answers the comparison with the given side.

Structs/Comparison.html#/s:19SortStateUn.name: callAsFunction(_:)
Structs/Comparison.html#/s:19SortStateUn.abstract: Answers the comparison with whether or not the left side won.

Structs/Comparison.html.name: Comparison
Structs/Comparison.html.abstract: A decision about the inherent order of two elements being sorted by an algorithm.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: Element
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: A type that represents the element that the algorithm is sorting.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: calculateMaximumNumberOfComparisonsInWorstCase(for:)
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: Returns the number of comparisons that the algorithm will perform, in the worst case, given an input

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: input
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: The given elements that the algorithm is sorting.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: output
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: The current result of applying the sorting algorithm to input.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: answer(_:)
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: Answers the current comparison with the given answer.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: callAsFunction()
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: Executes the algorithm in its current state and, if possible, advances it to the next state and returns the

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: peekAtElement(for:)
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: Returns the element that represents the given side of the current comparison.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: numberOfComparisonsInWorstCase
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: The number of comparisons that the algorithm will perform in the worst case.

Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.name: answering(_:)
Protocols/SortingAlgorithm.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: Returns the current algorithm after answering the current comparison with the given answer.

Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.name: comparison
Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: The comparison at this step in the sorting algorithm, if available.

Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.name: isComparison
Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the step is of case comparison.

Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.name: isFinished
Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the step is of case finished.

Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.name: isNotComparison
Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the step is not of case comparison.

Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.name: isNotFinished
Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the step is not of case finished.

Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.name: output
Enums/SortingAlgorithmStep.html#/s:19Sor.abstract: The output from the sorting algorithm, if available.

Enums/Complexity.html#/s:19SortStateUniv.name: allCasesInOrder
Enums/Complexity.html#/s:19SortStateUniv.abstract: A collection of all complexity values from least complex to most complex.

Enums/Complexity.html.name: Complexity
Enums/Complexity.html.abstract: The amount of computer time that it takes to run an algorithm.
